    • Method Detail

      • setInputReportListener

        public void setInputReportListener(InputReportListener listener)
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method sets the input report listener for this device.

        There can be only one input report listener at a time but it is possible to re-set the listener.

        Setting the input report listener is the only way to receive input reports from the device.

        The InputReportListener.onInputReport(purejavahidapi.HidDevice, byte, byte[], int) method is called from an internal (to the device instance) background thread and it is expected that the listener will process the data as quickly as possible and not do any length process in the callback.

        Overrides:
        setInputReportListener in class HidDevice
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener object or null to un-set

      • setDeviceRemovalListener

        public void setDeviceRemovalListener(DeviceRemovalListener listener)
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method sets the device removal listener.

        The DeviceRemovalListener.onDeviceRemoval(purejavahidapi.HidDevice) method of the device listener object will be called if and when the device is unexpectedly un-plugged. There can be only one device removal listener at a time but it is possible to re-set the listener.

        Overrides:
        setDeviceRemovalListener in class HidDevice
        Parameters:
        listener - the device removal listener object or null to un-set

      • getFeatureReport

        public int getFeatureReport(byte[] data,
                            int length)
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method reads a feature report from the device.

        See USB HID specification to learn more about feature reports.

        This method blocks until the 'length' number of bytes has been received to the 'data' buffer or the device is closed.

        This method returns the number of bytes actually received or -1 in case there was error in communicating with the device.

        As of this writing it is unclear under what circumstances something else than 'length' number of bytes could be returned as well as what happens if the report length does not match what the device expects.

        Specified by:
        getFeatureReport in class HidDevice
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to receive the data
        length - the size of the feature report
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually received or -1 if the call failed

      • setOutputReport

        public int setOutputReport(byte reportID,
                           byte[] data,
                           int length)
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method sends an output report to the device.

        If numbered reports are used (see USB HID specification for explanation about numbered reports) the reportID needs to be specified otherwise pass zero there.

        This method may or may not block.

        The method returning is no guarantee that the data has been physically transmitted from the host to the device.

        The method returns the actual number of bytes successfully scheduled to be sent to the device.

        As of this writing it is unclear under what circumstances something else than 'length' number of bytes could be returned as well as what happens if the report length does not match what the device expects.

        Specified by:
        setOutputReport in class HidDevice
        Parameters:
        reportID - the report number if numbered reports are used else pass 0
        data - a byte array containing the data to be sent
        length - the number of bytes to send from the data array
        Returns:
        number bytes actually sent or -1 if the send failed

      • setFeatureReport

        public int setFeatureReport(byte reportId,
                            byte[] data,
                            int length)
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method sends a feature report to the device.

        See USB HID specification to learn more about feature reports.

        This method may or may not block.

        The method returning is no guarantee that the data has been physically transmitted from the host to the device.

        The method returns the actual number of bytes successfully scheduled to be sent to the device.

        As of this writing it is unclear under what circumstances something else than 'length' number of bytes could be returned as well as what happens if the report length does not match what the device expects.

        Specified by:
        setFeatureReport in class HidDevice
        Parameters:
        reportId - a byte specifying the report ID to send
        data - a byte array containing the data to be sent
        length - the number of bytes to send from the data array
        Returns:
        number bytes actually sent or -1 if the call failed

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method closes the access to the device. After calling close no further method calls to this object must be done, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be generated. This call may block indefinitely if the device stops sending reports. (Hopefully in the future the close method will not block under any circumstances).
        Specified by:
        close in class HidDevice

      • getHidDeviceInfo

        public HidDeviceInfo getHidDeviceInfo()
        Description copied from class: HidDevice
        This method returns the same info that the PureJavaHidApi.enumerateDevices() would return for this device.
        Overrides:
        getHidDeviceInfo in class HidDevice
        Returns:
        the device info object
